com.lasarobotics.library.util

Class Timers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lasarobotics.library.util.Timers

  • public class Timers
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements advanced timers with events and precision manipulation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Timers()
      Instantiates the timer class with the default millisecond precision.
      Timers(int precision)
      Instantiates the timer class with an arbitrary precision in milliseconds.

    • Method Detail

      • startClock

        public void startClock(java.lang.String name)
        Start or resume (and create, if nonexistent) a clock with a specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - The clock name

      • exists

        public boolean exists(java.lang.String name)
        Test if a clock exists
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the clock
        Returns:
        True if the clock exists, false otherwise

      • createClock

        public void createClock(java.lang.String name)
        Create a clock with a given name. The clock will start PAUSED. If the clock already exists, no action will be taken
        Parameters:
        name - The clock name

      • pauseClock

        public void pauseClock(java.lang.String name)
        Pause a clock with a specified name. If a clock is already paused, no action will be taken.

        Internally, clocks are paused by setting the current clock uptime to it's opposite value. Therefore, to find if a clock is paused, check if the value is negative

        Parameters:
        name - The clock name

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning(java.lang.String name)
        Test if a clock is running
        Parameters:
        name - The clock name
        Returns:
        True if running, false if paused

      • resetClock

        public void resetClock(java.lang.String name)
        Reset a clock with the specified name. Clock will continue running immediately.
        Parameters:
        name - The clock name

      • resetClock

        public void resetClock(java.lang.String name,
              boolean paused)
        Reset a clock with the specified name and optionally start paused
        Parameters:
        name - The clock name

      • getClockValue

        public long getClockValue(java.lang.String name)
        Get clock value. Defaults to millisecond precision.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the clock
        Returns:
        Value of clock in milliseconds

      • getClockValue

        public long getClockValue(java.lang.String name,
                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Get clock value with precision in a given time unit
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the clock
        timeUnit - TimeUnit the output should be in
        Returns:
        The value of the clock converted to the time unit specified (may lose precision)

      • isAtTargetMillis

        public boolean isAtTargetMillis(java.lang.String name,
                       long target)
        Returns whether the clock is at the specified amount of milliseconds
        Parameters:
        name - The clock name
        target - The target time in milliseconds
        Returns:
        True if at the target (+- precision), false otherwise

      • isAtTargetMillis

        public boolean isAtTargetMillis(java.lang.String name,
                       long target,
                       long precision)
        Returns whether the clock is at the specified amount of milliseconds
        Parameters:
        name - The clock name
        target - The target time in milliseconds
        precision - How much target and clock value can differ by in milliseconds
        Returns:
        True if at the target (+- precision), false otherwise

      • getPrecision

        public long getPrecision()
        Gets the precision in milliseconds
        Returns:
        Precision in milliseconds

      • setPrecision

        public void setPrecision(int precision)
        Sets the precision to a value
        Parameters:
        precision - The precision of the clock, in milliseconds.
